Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; GLAZED
Name: Black glazed bowl with one handle
Description: Black glazed pottery cup with looped handle, of Greek style and manufacture, from the city of Naukratis in the Western Delta. The city was a unique Greek colony installed with the permission of the Egyptian kings in the 26th Dynasty, to channel the trade between the Nile valley and the Aegean.
